text:
Anaesthetic management of a 2-month-old infant for laser resection of vocal cord granuloma.
 A 2-month-old infant underwent excision of granulomata of vocal cords with a carbon dioxide laser.
 High frequency jet ventilation was given through a surgical metal suction tube during the operation.
 The anaesthetic technique for the infant and the problems of the use of carbon dioxide laser in laryngeal surgery are discussed.
